thread.title: Volquez to start World Series opener for Royals
thread.title_full: Volquez to start World Series opener for Royals

author: wtopstaff
title: Volquez to start World Series opener for Royals
text:
Home » News » Sports » MLB » Volquez to start World… Volquez to start World Series opener for Royals By DAVE SKRETTA October 26, 2015 2:41 pm Kansas City Royals starting pitcher Edinson Volquez reacts after walking Toronto Blue Jays' Jose Bautista to load the bases during the sixth inning in Game 5 of baseball's American League Championship Series on Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015, in Toronto. (Chris Young/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT 
KANSAS CITY, Mo. (AP) — Edinson Volquez will start the World Series opener for Kansas City, followed by Johnny Cueto in Game 2. 
Yordano Ventura will start Game 3 at Citi Field on Friday, followed by Chris Young in Game 4. 
New York’s rotation opens with Matt Harvey, and Jacob deGrom, Noah Syndergaard and Steven Matz follow. 
Volquez was 13-9 with a 3.55 ERA during the regular season and 1-2 with a 4.32 ERA during three starts in the playoffs. Topics:
